intro: Fimbristylis apus, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Fimbristylis apus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
